content: from the fold as shown in photo a i also think it helps to sew a label inside the beanie to the band at the point you finish off the button and the label help to quickly get the beanie on properly - label at the back of the head button to one side at the front that way if you give the slouchy as a gift there s no risk of people wearing it like a misshapen beret 😉 stitches & abbreviations repeat = repeat yo = yarn over st = stitch/es chain = chain ea = each slip_stitch = slip_stitch puff = puff the puff stitches in this pattern are mini-puffs or 2 yo puff st instructions yo insert hook yo pull up a loop yo insert hook in same st again yo pull up a loop yo pull through all 5 loops there is no chain 1 after this puff larger puff stitches usually/often include a ch1 to finish the stitch half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet yo insert hook yo pull up loop yo pull through all 3 loops half_double_crochet decrease = half_double_crochet decrease yo insert hook yo pull up loop yo insert hook in next stitch along yo pull up loop yo pull through all 4 loops camhdc & camhdc decrease = camel half_double_crochet & camel half_double_crochet decrease these are worked like normal hdcs and half_double_crochet decs except that camel stitches are worked in the loop of yarn at the back of the stitch you re crocheting into there is a front loop and a back loop to the v shape on top of the stitch but if you tilt the stitch toward you there is a 3rd loop of yarn at the back of the stitch this is where you insert the hook to camel stitch the youtube tutorial for this pattern demonstrates this stitch if you are unsure camsc = camel single_crochet insert hook into the camel loop at the back of the stitch you are working into yo and pull up a loop yo and pull through 2 loops inv join = invisible join if you aren t familiar with this technique i have a video tutorial for it https //youtu be/gh2dlroitgi i use this method instead of a slip_stitch to finish most of my crochet projects you need to cut your yarn and use a needle to work an invisible join but it gives a very neat finish wheelie made it crochet puff slouchy page 3 pattern magic_ring 1 chain 2 10 puffs into circle do not join 2 2 puffs into each st 20 st 3 1 puff into first st 2 into next st repeat to end of round 30 st 4 1 puff into ea stitch for 2 stitches then 2 puffs in next repeat 40 st 5 1 puff in ea st 40 st 6 1 puff in ea st for 3 st then 2 puffs in next st repeat 50 st 7 1 puff in ea st for 4
